The room was dirty, there was no mini bar, the bathroom was in need of modernisation, the towels in the bathroom were all stained, the bed was dirty, and the sheets smelt of sick.
reviews.title: Shambolic

likes.disliked: — some rude staff, awful breakfast in brasserie and overharging

reviews.text: We then ate in the restaurant ‘Raymonds Restaurant’ this was by far one of the worst restaurants I have ever eaten in…I ordered a pasta dish for my main course which comprised of a sheet of pasta rolled round some over cooked vegetables and poured over the top was a can of chopped tomatoes! The waiters / waitresses did not speak a word of English and could not help with any of the food on the menu which we were asking about.
reviews.title: Great ambience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa area was nice, however not relaxing as there were children running round everywhere and pressing every button in sight. The spa treatments were well over priced, in fact the hotel itself was over priced. I would not advise anyone to stay at Carden park and I would not go back there ever again! It was a disgusting hotel which should not be so highly classed!!
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel & surroundings!

likes.liked: — Everything apart from the overpriced food

reviews.text: Potentially a good hotel, but badly let down by poor management, inability to deliver on promises and some very rude staff.
reviews.title: great family break

likes.disliked: — standard of servce in brasserie restaurant and overpriced food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a weekend 12-14 Oct 07. Grounds very pretty, with ornamental lakes as well as the golf course. We paid £310 for a king room with golf course view, breakfast both days and £50 credit towards dinner on the first night. Our room was on the ground floor of the main building, with big windows with a views over the golf course and appeared to have been refurbished .I understand the courtyard rooms in separate smaller blocks have not yet been overhauled. The room was clean, spacious and nicely decorated. The bathroom was also a good size.
reviews.title: Romantic getaway

reviews.text: We found the leisure facilities to be very good, with a thoughtfully designed 20m pool, Jacuzzi, sauna, steam room, and a gym. Children are not permitted in the pool area after 6pm or before 10am, allowing adults a decent amount of time to themselves.
reviews.title: Loved Carden Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dining – there are 2 restaurants, Redmonds, and the Brasserie. Redmonds offers dinner for £28 for a 3 course meal with choice of approx 7 starters, 7 mains and 7 desserts. The menu changes daily and is posted outside the restaurant at 6pm. As Redmonds offers better value for money and your dining options outside the hotel are minimal, Redmonds is very popular and books up quickly. Suggest making your dinner reservations when you book the hotel. We never made it to Redmonds because of this. We ate in the Brasserie both nights and found the food and service to be very good, if not exactly cheap (£14 for a bowl of pasta, £26 for a steak). We enjoyed breakfast in Redmonds which is buffet-style & consists of cereal, pastries, fruit, yogurt & full cooked breakfast. On Saturday there was a queue for the buffet, but on Sunday they resolved this by adding an extra hot food station. It looks as though they may also offer the same breakfast in the Brasserie without the queues – it may be worth enquiring on your arrival. Drinks in Morgans bar were on a par with prices you’d pay in most places (£3.50 for a Smirnoff Ice), with the added bonus of roaming waiters providing table service so you don’t have to get up.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!

reviews.text: Before choosing this hotel we had researched several other DeVere hotels on Tripadvisor and the recurring theme seemed to be the issue of staff with poor English skills and a seemingly uncaring attitude. This problem does not seem to have reached Carden Park yet. The reception, bar and restaurant staff seemed to be 90% British with a couple of others whose English was impeccable. I noticed a few eastern European maids, who all acknowledged guests with a “Good morning”. All staff seemed friendly and helpful. Any minor issues were swiftly resolved.
reviews.title: what a find

reviews.text: If you go into Chester, I highly recommend using the park & ride(Boughton Heath stop) which is on the main road from the hotel to Chester (A41) £1.50 return per adult and very frequent. Chester has a one-way system and parking prices are £2.50/hr! Nice trips out are Beeston Castle and Hawkstone Follies.
reviews.title: Not quite the relaxing weekend we expected

reviews.text: We had a nice stay at Carden Park but the atmosphere was a bit too busy. The staff did handle the crowd quite well though (especially at dinner).
reviews.title: Nice stay. A little too busy

reviews.text: To their credit my wife and I only spent one night there and we had just spent the entire day in a huge traffic jam due to the flooding in the area so maybe I just wasn't as chipper as I should have been.
reviews.title: What a waste of money!

reviews.text: The hotel itself was quite amazing though.
reviews.title: Threw up at the dinner table!!!!!!

likes.liked: — Nice lodges; staff very helpful - called a pizza delivery for us after room service had finished!!

reviews.text: On our next visit to Chester we will probably try to find a hotel with a bit more relaxing atmosphere (a preference of my wife and I when choosing hotels).
reviews.title: Deservedly excellent

likes.disliked: — Too relaxing, couldn't get out of bed in the morning !

reviews.text: My friend and I decided to spend a day in the spa having treatment as I was due to get marry the following week, what suppose to be a perfect day turned into a big disappointment! We both arrived on time and told to have morning coffee in the cafe but no one told us we had to go upstairs to wait for our treatments, so when we finally ask the staff about it we were told because we were late so they had to cut time off my friend's pedicure! the massage I had was terrible, I'm a spa junkie so I've had many massages in the pass and that was definatly one of the worst. the area where you have lunch was noisy, it wasn't relaxing at all, in the end I had to complaint to the manager who seem puzzeled. For the amount of money I paid I would've got a better service from a high street salon. DONT GO THERE.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - luxurious getaway

reviews.text: we booked 2 family rooms via laterooms.com. the hotel was excellent in every way, and lived up to the 4 star rating. the rooms were big, and beds very comfortable. spa and pool were lovely. the buffet breakfast was fresh and was of a very high standard. the chef was present cooking fresh eggs and omelettes to order.
reviews.title: faultless

reviews.text: the most impressive aspect of the stay was that all staff were friendly, and were very accommodating of our requests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the setting of the hotel is great and my room was lovely with the most comfortable bed!
reviews.title: Truly a relaxing stay, shame about the Spa

reviews.text: Stayed at Carden Park on a saturday in june with my sister and two friends. We are all working mums who live in Derbyshire,Cheshire and Shropshire and thought it would be really great to treat ourselves to a well deserved spa break and get together. The spa break was a disaster as we booked massages when we arrived which were ok but then afterwards there was nowhere to relax by the pool as it only had about 14 loungers and they were all taken up by families with children. The spa facilities are also the hotel guests facilities so so much for our relaxing get-away. We may as well have just booked a night at the hotel with diner and breakfast. If you want a relaxing spa break dont go here, if you want a hotel break then i would say try it. The rooms were lovely with extremely comfy beds and the evening meal was nice but breakfast was a disaster .The breakfast area was tiny compared to the size of the hotel and the staff very un organised. The hot buffet breakfast was cold and we had to ask for plates and glasses as these had run out and not been replenished. We also had to chase someone for coffe and toast orders and the toast arrived when we had finished. Why isnt there a toast machine available as in most hotels now? My suggestion would be to skip breakfast or order breakfast in bed, you may do better. Overall nice as a hotel break with lots of outdoor activities available but stay clear as a spa break.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but terrible as a spa break !!!

reviews.text: We booked the hotel via laterooms.com at £110 for a family of four including breakfast for one night, we considered this great value! The room had two double beds which was fine although our bed was not very comfortable and sagged in the middle making for a long night. The hotel facilities were great for our kids (11 & 13), we all enjoyed the pool and spa, we hit a few golf balls in the driving range where the staff were super helpful loaning us a range of clubs, even though they had just closed for the evening. The kids then played tennis for free as we had our own rackets giving us 90 minutes to enjoy another swim in a now quiet pool as children are not permitted to swim after 6pm.
reviews.title: great value for a family break

reviews.text: We got up early for breakfast and although the hotel appeared full there was no waiting. The breakfast was enjoyed by all. So all in all a great value night away for an active family with teenagers!
reviews.title: Excellent Weekend

reviews.text: From start to finish we had a great weekend. From the concierge staff parking the car and carrying our luggage.

description: Carden Park Hotel Golf Resort and Spa - Located within 1000 acres of beautiful Cheshire countryside, Carden Park offers the perfect destination for both business and pleasure. Boasting 2 championship golf courses, the Nicklaus and the Cheshire plus all the golfing facilities any keen golfer could need including practice greens, driving range and Clubhouse with pro shop.Rosette awarded dining in Redmond's Restaurant offering a formal dining experience. Alternatively try The Vines, inspired by the onsite vineyard, enjoy informal dining with speciality dishes including local steaks and hanging kebabs. Additional dining venues include Jack's Bar in the Clubhouse, welcoming golfers and non-golfers and Morgan's bar, ideal for afternoon tea.Award winning Spa with 20 treatments areas and over 40 treatments of choice plus spa days and spa breaks using the highest quality products.196 stunning bedrooms, many with views over the golf course and Welsh hills beyond.Full conference facilities with a choice of 18 meeting rooms and additional activities onsite include jogging routes, tennis courts and children's playground. The onsite activities centre offers KONG aerial ropes course, Quad biking, segways, laser clay shooting, archery and much more!
